content.description: From the paved parking lot 1 mile west of the Beige Siphon Tube, walk west along the road for 90 feet to the obvious steep gully on the south side of the highway.  Hike up 150 feet to the base of the rock (The Beer Slabs).  Pitch one is run out if you don't bring supplemental gear and rated 5.8.  Pitch two up the face right or left, both ways are 5.10 and bolt protected.  Two rope rap to the base or two single line raps.
content.protection: Pitch one - two bolts supplimented with small nuts or cams. Rap 85 feet of tandum bolts or continue up other routes.

content.description: Crux is crimpy section with poor feet 2nd bolt to 4th bolt. Your fingers may snap and crackle getting through this if you feet aren't precise.
content.protection: 4 bolts, no other gear.  Chain at top.
content.location:
The route is on the Upper Beer Slab. Start below and left of big platform/block.  Same start sharing 1st bolt of

Amber Waves

.  Go up and right at 1st bolt above the platform and let the crimpfest begin past 3 more bolts. 45 foot rap off chains then 85 foot to base, or one long 130 foot rap (2 ropes) to base.

content.description:
Crux is awkward left leaning start.  Good way to get to the chains to TR

Amber Waves of Grain

or

Snap, Crackle, and Hops

.
content.protection: Cams and nuts to 2 inches.  Chains at top.
content.location: Route is on the Upper Beer Slab, left-leaning crack on far right side of rock.  130 foot rap to base from the chains or two single raps, 45 and 85 feet to base.  Walk down gully.

content.description: Crux is righward traverse at last bolt.  Stemming and good foot work get you up.
content.protection: 3 bolts and one or two small (0.33-0.5) gear placements to supplement between 2nd and 3rd bolt.  Chains at top.
content.location:
Route is on Upper Beer Slab.  Start below and left of big platform/block, Start shares first bolt with

Snap, Crackle and Hops

.  Route is bolt line on far left of slab.  Top of route goes right at last bolt to chains.

content.description:
From the paved parking lot 1 mile west of the Beige Siphon Tube walk west for 90 feet to the obvious steep gully on the south side of the road.  Hike up 160 feet to the base of the climb.  This is the Beer Slab.

Pitch one - up thin slabs to a broken section with one bolt.  Wander up past (5.8) using small gear for protection to the big ledge.

Pitch two - up the leaning crack  (5.5) to the chains.  Rap 130 feet to base.
content.protection: Pitch one.  nuts and one bolt.  Pitch two.  Gear to 2 inches.  two chain rap, 130 feet to the bottom.
